clinical_study.brief_title: Association of Lutein, Zeaxanthin and Brilliant Blue in Chromovitrectomy
clinical_study.official_title: A Descriptive Study to Evaluate the Effectiveness of the Dye Compound of the Combination of Lutein, Zeaxanthin and Brilliant Blue in Chromovitrectomy

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to test the efficacy of the combination of dye Lutein, Zeaxanthin and brilliant blue to stain the internal limiting membrane as well as the epiretinal membranes during the Vitrectomy surgery.

detailed_description.textblock: Twenty five patients with epiretinal membrane, macular hole or proliferative diabetic retinopathy and indication of vitrectomy surgery will be selected to participate in this study.

primary_outcome.measure: Visibility of the membrane after injection of the dye
primary_outcome.description: The visibility of the membrane after injection of the dye should be graduated by the physician as Bad, OR Fair, OR Good, OR Very Good

secondary_outcome.measure: Degree of impregnation of the dye
secondary_outcome.description: The degree of impregnation of the membrane by the dye should be graduated according to the following scale:(0)not flushed; (1)stained weakly (light green); (2)moderately stained (medium green); (3)stained intensely (dark green)
the physician should evaluate the usefulness of the dye, according to the following scale: Bad, Fair, Good, Very Good

arm_group.description: during the surgery will be evaluated if the dye is suitable for dyeing the internal limiting membrane as well as the epiretinal membrane

intervention.intervention_name: Dye of Lutein, Zeaxanthin and Brilliant Blue
intervention.description: dye composed of Lutein, Zeaxanthin and Brilliant Blue will be used during the vitrectomy surgery to dye the membranes

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients over 18 years, both gender
- Diagnosis of epiretinal membrane OR macular hole OR proliferative diabetic retinopathy
- Indication of surgical treatment for removal of the epiretinal membrane
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any history of eye disease
- glaucoma
- Eye infection affecting any structure provided eye
